result.execSummary:
The defendant Branden Tremaine Raymond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence; release for work, inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 4 days (4-23-2015 to 04-26-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. Fine is set at ZERO.

Seek/Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
Weekly job searches.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No contact with Bayshore Mall Property, Milwaukee, WI
No contact with Lana B. (DOB 03-10-1987).

Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first 9 months of probation.

timeConds.notes:
Without good time credit; release for work, inmate work assignments and participation in the Multicultural Community Services Training Program. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. This is stayed to use as follows: 
* First violation of any positive drug or alcohol test, defendant to serve 10 days.
* Second violation of any positive drug or alcohol test, defendant to serve 20 days.
* Third violation of any positive drug or alcohol test, defendant to serve 30 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Branden Tremaine Raymond

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Branden Tremaine Raymond in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1-
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; release for work, inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 4 days (4-23-2015 to 04-26-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first 9 months of probation.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Seek/Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Weekly job searches.
- No contact with Bayshore Mall Property, Milwaukee, WI
- No contact with Lana B. (DOB 03-10-1987).
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 60 DAYS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for work, inmate work assignments and participation in the Multicultural Community Services Training Program. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. This is stayed to use as follows: 
* First violation of any positive drug or alcohol test, defendant to serve 10 days.
* Second violation of any positive drug or alcohol test, defendant to serve 20 days.
* Third violation of any positive drug or alcohol test, defendant to serve 30 days.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated September 29, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Branden Tremaine Raymond in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for Sentencing hearing. Defense counsel notified the Court that she will no longer be with the office. Court grants Attorney Procaccio to withdraw. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 09-30-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated August 11, 2015 received and filed. tk

AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court vacated jury trial scheduled on 07-20-2015. Court addresses the Justice Point received and notes Defendant continues to comply. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 08-14-2015 at 8:30 am, Branch 17. Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310.

Defendant Branden Tremaine Raymond in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart. Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State motions to withdraw amended information filed. on 06-29-2015. Court withdrew amended information. Case proceeded to plea hearing. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated July 2, 2015 received and filed. tk
Amended informaion received and filed. tk
State's Witness List, State's Motion in Limine, and State's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed. tk

Defendant Branden Tremaine Raymond in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart. Brandon Wigley on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for final pretrial. For reason placed on the record, case is adjourned for final pretrial on 07-02-2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 17. Jury trial remains scheduled on 07-20-2015 at 9:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated June 26, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Branden Tremaine Raymond in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.   Defense requests case be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 17.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report date May 18, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Branden Tremaine Raymond in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Ronald Dague for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  No Information is provided by the State.  Arraignment scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/1/15.

15RM021991  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/25/2015
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with The Bayshore  Mall Campus.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Branden Tremaine Raymond in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Branden Tremaine Raymond in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
